verses.verse: Lo, <WH2005> mine eye<WH5869> hath seen<WH7200> all<WH3605> this, mine ear<WH241> hath heard<WH8085> and understood<WH995> it.
What ye know,<WH1847> the same do I<WH589> know<WH3045> also:<WH1571> I<WH595> am not<WH3808> inferior<WH5307> unto<WH4480> you.
Surely <WH199> I<WH589> would speak<WH1696> to<WH413> the Almighty,<WH7706> and I desire<WH2654> to reason<WH3198> with<WH413> God.<WH410>
But <WH199> ye<WH859> are forgers<WH2950> of lies,<WH8267> ye are all<WH3605> physicians<WH7495> of no value.<WH457>
O that<WH4130> ye would<WH5414> altogether hold your peace!<WH2790> <WH2790> and it should be<WH1961> your wisdom.<WH2451>
Hear <WH8085> now<WH4994> my reasoning,<WH8433> and hearken<WH7181> to the pleadings<WH7379> of my lips.<WH8193>
Will ye speak<WH1696> wickedly<WH5766> for God?<WH410> and talk<WH1696> deceitfully<WH7423> for him?
Will ye accept<WH5375> his person?<WH6440> will ye contend<WH7378> for God?<WH410>
Is it good<WH2896> that<WH3588> he should search you out?<WH2713> <WH853> or<WH518> as one man<WH582> mocketh<WH2048> another, do ye so mock<WH2048> him?
He will surely reprove<WH3198> <WH3198> you, if<WH518> ye do secretly<WH5643> accept<WH5375> persons.<WH6440>
Shall not<WH3808> his excellency<WH7613> make you afraid?<WH1204> and his dread<WH6343> fall<WH5307> upon<WH5921> you?
Your remembrances<WH2146> are like<WH4912> unto ashes,<WH665> your bodies<WH1354> to bodies<WH1354> of clay.<WH2563>
Hold your peace,<WH2790> let me alone,<WH4480> that I<WH589> may speak,<WH1696> and let come<WH5674> on<WH5921> me what<WH4100> will.
Wherefore <WH5921> <WH4100> do I take<WH5375> my flesh<WH1320> in my teeth,<WH8127> and put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in mine hand?<WH3709>
Though <WH2005> he slay<WH6991> me, yet will I trust<WH3176> in him: but<WH389> I will maintain<WH3198> mine own ways<WH1870> before<WH413> <WH6440> him.
He <WH1931> also<WH1571> shall be my salvation:<WH3444> for<WH3588> a hypocrite<WH2611> shall not<WH3808> come<WH935> before<WH6440> him.
Hear diligently<WH8085> <WH8085> my speech,<WH4405> and my declaration<WH262> with your ears.<WH241>
Behold <WH2009> now,<WH4994> I have ordered<WH6186> my cause;<WH4941> I know<WH3045> that<WH3588> I<WH589> shall be justified.<WH6663>
Who <WH4310> is he<WH1931> that will plead<WH7378> with<WH5978> me? for<WH3588> now,<WH6258> if I hold my tongue,<WH2790> I shall give up the ghost.<WH1478>
Only <WH389> do<WH6213> not<WH408> two<WH8147> things unto<WH5978> me: then<WH227> will I not<WH3808> hide myself<WH5641> from<WH4480> <WH6440> thee.
Withdraw <WH7368> thine hand<WH3709> far from<WH4480> <WH5921> me: and let not<WH408> thy dread<WH367> make me afraid.<WH1204>
Then call<WH7121> thou, and I<WH595> will answer:<WH6030> or<WH176> let me speak,<WH1696> and answer<WH7725> thou me.
How <WH4100> many are mine iniquities<WH5771> and sins?<WH2403> make me to know<WH3045> my transgression<WH6588> and my sin.<WH2403>
Wherefore <WH4100> hidest<WH5641> thou thy face,<WH6440> and holdest<WH2803> me for thine enemy?<WH341>
Wilt thou break<WH6206> a leaf<WH5929> driven to and fro?<WH5086> and wilt thou pursue<WH7291> the dry<WH3002> stubble?<WH7179>
For <WH3588> thou writest<WH3789> bitter things<WH4846> against<WH5921> me, and makest me to possess<WH3423> the iniquities<WH5771> of my youth.<WH5271>

Thou puttest<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> also in the stocks,<WH5465> and lookest narrowly<WH8104> unto all<WH3605> my paths;<WH734> thou settest a print<WH2707> upon<WH5921> the heels<WH8328> of my feet.<WH7272>
And he,<WH1931> as a rotten thing,<WH7538> consumeth,<WH1086> as a garment<WH899> that is moth<WH6211> eaten.<WH398>
